meanings.sent1: She tends to fumble with her keys when opening the door.
meanings.sent2: Please don't fumble the fragile vase while moving it.
meanings.sent3: Trying to juggle too many things, she managed to fumble her phone into the sink.
meanings.sent4: His attempts to fix the broken toy only caused him to fumble it further.
meanings.sent5: The nervous student began to fumble with the buttons on his shirt during the presentation.

meanings.definition: To make a mess of; bungle.
meanings.sent1: He tends to fumble important tasks when under pressure.
meanings.sent2: If you rush, you might fumble the recipe and ruin the dish.
meanings.sent3: In his attempt to impress, he managed to fumble the entire conversation.
meanings.sent4: The comedian tried to tell a joke but ended up fumbling the punchline.
meanings.sent5: The new employee was nervous and started to fumble the simple instructions given to him.

meanings.sent1: She accidentally fumbled for the light switch in the dark room.
meanings.sent2: The blindfolded person had to fumble around to find the hidden object.
meanings.sent3: During the game of pin the tail on the donkey, the kids fumbled around blindly.
meanings.sent4: The explorer had to fumble through the dark cave without a torch.
meanings.sent5: The lost hiker had to fumble through the dense forest to find his way back to the trail.
